title: Justin Timberlake says family life with Jessica Biel and son is like a 'baptism'
text:
CLOSE Fans and friends of Louis Vuitton, including Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel, Jennifer Connelly and K-pop band Itzy, at Paris Fashion Week. (Oct. 1) AP Entertainment

Maybe we don't need another reason to gush over celebrity couple Justin Timberlake and Jessica Biel, but why wouldn't you want to?

They're just so #couplegoals, and you can put them on your vision boards for 2020 if that's still a thing. If not, they're reason alone to revive them.

ET caught up with Timberlake, 38, in his hometown of Memphis, Tennessee. He deflected some of the attention onto his wife, Jessica Biel, star of "The Sinner."

Timberlake said Biel, the mother of his son, Silas, 4, has changed him "in so many ways." They married in 2012 and announced the birth of their son, Silas Randall, in 2015.

"It's like once you find that person, it's like a baptism, where you're like, 'I can't go back,' you know what I mean?" Timberlake said.

Last year, Biel helped him through a rough time when he had to cancel shows because of bruised vocal chords and was put on voice rest.

"To have somebody by your side to really go through it with you and get in the mud with you, so to speak, I'm sure you know what that's like," he said.

This month, the couple stood strong as they were the target of a celebrity prankster at Paris Fashion Week. Vitalii Sediuk jumped out of the crowd and tried to tackle Timberlake who had arrived with Biel. Biel was confused but held tight to her husband's hand as security led Sediuk away.

Contributing: Cydney Henderson

description: Marriage to Jessica Biel and fatherhood were such profound events that Justin Timberlake compared them to a baptism, saying he can't "go back."
